Name: Fragment of a glass vase
Description: This fragment of a vase is a beautiful example of the art of the glassworker, which has known its peak in Egypt during the 18th Dynasty. The glasses were run in strips of different colours around a stone extracted after cooling. The motifs in the form of waves were obtained by stretching the bands of colours by means of a stylet. The surface of the glass was then polished. It is possible that the fragment came from a Theban workshop from the era of Amenhotep III.
